title: Intuitive Machines to Carry ESA Prospect Payload to Lunar Surface
summary: NASA has awarded Intuitive Machines a $116.9 million contract to carry six payloads to the surface of the Moon aboard its Nova-C lunar lander. One of the six payloads aboard the lander will be the European Prospect payload, which will drill into a lunar surface to search for water deposits. In January 2020, the European […]

title: Cluster’s Salsa satellite primed to reenter and break up
summary: On 8 September 2024, Salsa (Cluster 2), one of four satellites that make up ESA’s Cluster mission, will reenter Earth’s atmosphere over the South Pacific Ocean Uninhabited Area.

title: Hubble Zooms into the Rosy Tendrils of Andromeda
summary: Clusters of stars set the interstellar medium ablaze in the Andromeda Galaxy about 2.5 million light-years away. Also known as M31, Andromeda is the Milky Way’s closest major galaxy. It measures approximately 152,000 light-years across and, with almost the same mass as our home galaxy, is headed for a collision with the Milky Way in […]

title: 25 Years Strong: NASA’s Student Launch Competition Accepting 2025 Proposals
summary: By Wayne Smith NASA’s Student Launch competition kicks off its 25th year with the release of the 2025 handbook, detailing how teams can submit proposals by Wednesday, Sept. 11, for the event scheduled next spring near NASA’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. Student Launch is an annual competition challenging middle school, high school, […]

title: Sentinel-2C: ready for liftoff
summary: Sentinel-2C is ready for launch! The new satellite will soon join its Copernicus Sentinel-2 family in orbit – where it will continue to provide detailed views of Earth’s land and coastal waters.

title: Discover where space begins: the guide to ESA’s establishments
summary: Discover where space begins: the guide to ESA’s establishments

title: European drill and mini lab secure ride to the Moon
summary: ESA's Prospect package, including drill and a miniaturised laboratory, will fly to the Moon’s South Polar region in search of volatiles, including water ice, as part of NASA’s Commercial Lunar Payload Services initiative.

title: Chinese researchers assess U.S. space situational awareness, call for boost in China’s capabilities
summary: HELSINKI — Chinese researchers are calling for improved space situational awareness, following an assessment of U.S. capabilities and trends. An article titled “A Review of Space Situational Awareness Satellites: Silentbarker,” […]

title: Starliner return from ISS set for Sept. 6
summary: Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner will depart from the International Space Station Sept. 6, ending a three-month flight that saw the spacecraft unable to demonstrate its ability to safely return astronauts from orbit.
